sadness.text: A feeling of sorrow or unhappiness.

admiration.text: A feeling of respect and approval.

neutral.text: A state of no particular emotion.

love.text: An intense feeling of deep affection.

disapproval.text: A feeling of dislike or disagreement.

amusement.text: A feeling of entertainment and enjoyment.

disappointment.text: A feeling of sadness when expectations are not met.

annoyance.text: A feeling of being irritated or disturbed.

confusion.text: A state of being uncertain or unclear.

optimism.text: Hopefulness and confidence about the future.

curiosity.text: A strong desire to learn or know something.

excitement.text: A feeling of great enthusiasm and eagerness.

caring.text: Displaying kindness and concern for others.

disgust.text: A strong feeling of dislike or disapproval.

remorse.text: A feeling of regret or guilt for past actions.

joy.text: A feeling of great happiness and delight.

embarrassment.text: A feeling of self-consciousness and awkwardness.

anger.text: A strong feeling of displeasure or rage.

grief.text: A deep sorrow, especially caused by loss.

pride.text: A feeling of satisfaction in one’s achievements.

desire.text: A strong feeling of wanting something.

relief.text: A feeling of reassurance and relaxation.

fear.text: A distressing emotion caused by perceived danger.

nervousness.text: A feeling of anxiety and unease.
